Bug Report - KAN-48 Testing

Bug 1: Interns Cannot View Their Application Requests

Description

When an intern clicks on opportunities (e.g., “new chatbot”) and submits an application via “I’m Interested” button, they cannot see their submitted application anywhere in the UI. The application is submitted successfully to the backend, but there’s no view for interns to track their application status.

Current Behavior

  1. Intern navigates to Opportunities tab (AmbitionsTab)
  2. Intern clicks “I’m Interested” on a project
  3. Application is submitted to /api/join-requests endpoint
  4. Success notification appears
  5. Problem: Intern has no way to view their submitted application

Expected Behavior

Interns should be able to: 1. View all their submitted applications 2. See the status of each application (pending, approved, declined) 3. Track which projects they’ve applied to

Root Cause

  • RequestsTab.tsx only fetches /api/incoming-requests which shows requests TO projects the user manages
  • There’s no endpoint or UI to fetch /api/outgoing-requests or /api/my-applications for interns to see their OWN submitted applications
  • The RequestsTab is designed for leaders/managers to review incoming applications, not for interns to track their outgoing applications

Affected Files

  • src/components/carbon/RequestsTab.tsx - Only shows incoming requests for leaders
  • src/components/carbon/AmbitionsTab.tsx - Submits applications but no follow-up view
  • Missing: API endpoint for fetching user’s own applications
  • Missing: UI component for interns to view their applications

Bug 2: Leaders Cannot Create Projects from Your Projects Tab

Description

When a leader navigates to the “Your Projects” tab, there is no “Create Project” button available. Leaders can only view their existing projects but cannot create new ones from this view.

Current Behavior

  1. Leader navigates to “Your Projects” tab
  2. Only sees list of managed and contributing projects
  3. Problem: No “Create Project” button visible

Expected Behavior

Leaders should be able to: 1. See a “Create Project” button in the Your Projects tab 2. Click it to open the CreateProjectModal 3. Create new projects directly from this view

Root Cause

  • YourProjectsTab.tsx doesn’t include a “Create Project” button
  • The CreateProjectModal component exists and works
  • The button is available in AmbitionsTab but not in YourProjectsTab
  • Leaders expect to create projects from “Your Projects” since that’s where they manage their projects

Affected Files

  • src/components/carbon/YourProjectsTab.tsx - Missing create button
  • src/components/carbon/CreateProjectModal.tsx - Component exists but not used in YourProjectsTab

Test Plan

Bug 1 Tests

  1. Test intern can submit application
  2. Test intern cannot view their applications (should fail - bug exists)
  3. Test RequestsTab only shows incoming requests for leaders
  4. Test no endpoint exists for fetching user’s own applications

Bug 2 Tests

  1. Test YourProjectsTab renders for leaders
  2. Test no “Create Project” button exists (should fail - bug exists)
  3. Test CreateProjectModal component exists and works
  4. Test AmbitionsTab has create button (for comparison)

Proposed Fixes

Fix for Bug 1

  1. Create new API endpoint: GET /api/my-applications to fetch user’s own applications
  2. Add a new tab or section in RequestsTab for interns: “My Applications”
  3. Display application status, project name, date submitted, and any feedback
  4. Allow interns to withdraw pending applications

Fix for Bug 2

  1. Add “Create Project” button to YourProjectsTab header
  2. Import and use CreateProjectModal in YourProjectsTab
  3. Add state management for modal open/close
  4. Refresh project list after successful creation
